name: places/ChIJvwuQG3ZZwokRz_Qu5VrVLkw
formattedAddress: 20 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: Ralph is incredible. Followed him here from a previous location. Not only does he collaborate with me on new styles to keep things fresh, but what I love most is that his work is consistent. Great guy, good conversation, he’s definitely a go-to

text.text: Ralph is incredible. Followed him here from a previous location. Not only does he collaborate with me on new styles to keep things fresh, but what I love most is that his work is consistent. Great guy, good conversation, he’s definitely a go-to

originalText.text: I’ve been in to see Ralph three times now and every time I have left feeling great about my haircut. I have never felt comfortable finding a barber because I have always felt intimidated or shut down by them. Ralph has always been easy to talk to and listens to what I ask for. Best fades I have ever had.

text.text: I’ve been in to see Ralph three times now and every time I have left feeling great about my haircut. Best fades I have ever had.

originalText.text: Been getting my hair cut with Hung for the last 3 years and he’s absolutely amazing at what he does, but also a super down to earth guy. Feels like we’re just two friends catching up but I leave with a great haircut. Moved to a different neighborhood but kept the same barber—that says something. Hopefully will never have to find another one.

originalText.text:
Ralph went above and beyond my expectations, giving me a much needed refresh before visiting family overseas.
He was professional, insightful, and personable.

The space was clean and inviting, convenient location.
5/5!

text.text:
Ralph went above and beyond my expectations, giving me a much needed refresh before visiting family overseas.
He was professional, insightful, and personable.

The space was clean and inviting, convenient location.
5/5!

originalText.text:
Had a very odd experience today. Decided to try out this location as it's not far from my apartment. My barber takes me to the chair - everything seemed normal at first but he was moving very quickly and jumping around to different parts of my hair randomly, the cut was uncomfortable and he kept hitting my ear with the buzzer so I finally asked him to slow down after the fourth time he hit my ear. He apologized and then told me I needed to keep my hands inside the chair (my hands were folded in my lap the whole time).

He then started rubbing his face over and over again and eventually walked into the towel closet without saying anything. It appeared like he was either upset or on drugs. I asked the other barber to check on him, and he came back out 5 min later and said he would finish me after he was done with his client, so I went to sit in the front while I waited.

I would have left at this point but my hair was 1/2 cut. The new barber finished my hair and did an ok job, I just wanted to get out of there, it was very odd and uncomfortable. The other guy never came out of the closet. They still charged me the full $50.... I'm gonna stick to my other barbers in Hells Kitchen from now on... this was by far the strangest haircut I've received.
